channel.title: Comment on a minority
channel.description:
This series explores minority issues in the United States in the mid-20th century.

An online collection of early educational public radio content from the National Association of Educational Broadcasters (NAEB).

item.title: Elmer Carter
item.description: This program features an interview with Elmer Carter, commissioner of the New York State Commission Against Discrimination.
item.dc:creator: Richter, E.W.
item.dc:subject: United States--Race relations--20th century

item.title: Edward Howden
item.description: This program features an interview with Edward Howden, focusing on the position of African Americans in the San Francisco area.
item.dc:creator: Richter, E.W.
item.dc:subject: United States--Race relations--20th century

item.title: Benjamin E. Mays
item.description: This program features an interview with Benjamin E. Mays, a minister, educator, sociologist, social activist and the president of Morehouse College in Atlanta, Georgia.
item.dc:creator: Richter, E.W.
item.dc:subject: United States--Race relations--20th century

item.title: Homer Carmichael
item.description: This program features excerpts from a lecture given by Homer Carmichael, superintendant of schools in Louisville, Kentucky.
item.dc:creator: Richter, E.W.
item.dc:subject: United States--Race relations--20th century

item.title: J. Waties Waring
item.description: This program features an interview with J. Waties Waring, a United States federal judge who was involved in the early lawsuits of the American Civil Rights movement.
item.dc:creator: Richter, E.W.
item.dc:subject: United States--Race relations--20th century

item.title: E. Franklin Frazier
item.description: This program features an interview with E. Franklin Frazier, an American sociologist and author.
item.dc:creator: Richter, E.W.
item.dc:subject: United States--Race relations--20th century

item.title: John Buggs
item.description: In this program, John Buggs talks about African American life in Los Angeles, California.
item.dc:creator: Richter, E.W.
item.dc:subject: United States--History--20th century

item.title: Harold C. Fleming
item.description: This program features Harold C. Fleming discussing issues of discrimination against African Americans in the United States.
item.dc:creator: Richter, E.W.
item.dc:subject: United States--Race relations--20th century

item.title: Lillian Smith
item.description: This program features an interview with Lillian Smith, a writer and social critic.
item.dc:creator: Richter, E.W.
item.dc:subject: United States--Race relations--20th century

item.title: Rayford Logan
item.description: This program features an interview with Dr. Rayford Logan, an African-American historian and Pan-African activist.
item.dc:creator: Richter, E.W.
item.dc:subject: United States--Race relations--20th century

item.title: William Borders
item.description: This program features an interview with Reverend William Borders, a civil rights activist and pastor.
item.dc:creator: Richter, E.W.
item.dc:subject: United States--Race relations--20th century

item.title: Dr. Arnold Rose
item.description: This program, the last in the series, presents an interview with Dr. Arnold Rose, a sociologist.
item.dc:creator: Richter, E.W.
item.dc:subject: United States--Race relations--20th century

item.title: Pauli Murray
item.description: This program features Pauli Murray, an activist, lawyer, and author. Murray discusses discrimination against African Americans in the United States.
item.dc:creator: Richter, E.W.
item.dc:subject: United States--Race relations--20th century
